üéØ 2. Your Objectives

I can use variables that change in relationship to one another to represent two quantities in a real world problem. (6.EE.9)

I can write an equation to show one quantity (the dependent variable) in terms of the other quantity (the independent variable). (6.EE.9)

I can use graphs and tables to show the relationship between dependent and independent variables. (6.EE.9)

üó∫Ô∏è 4. The Adventure (Activity)

üìú Verbatim Instructions:

Together: Pretend we are planning a trip to an amusement park in Orlando, Florida. Which amusement park would you like to go to? Research what parks you can visit. What do you need to plan if you want to go on a trip? Discuss: How will we get there? How do we get around once we are there? Where will we stay? What will we eat? What time of year should we go? Is it cold or hot? Does it get colder at night? How late is the park open?

Help solve problems on the Family Vacation worksheet. Then take the final total and divide by either 6 or 12 months to see how much the family would need to save each month to go on this vacation. They may be able to decide to change some of the activities too.

Extension: If your family wants to plan a family vacation somewhere else, work together to decide how much it would cost to go to the other location.

For some of the online activities you will need a free CK12 account.

To create a CK12 account:

Go to: https://www.ck12.org/student/

Click on the orange JOIN button in the upper right corner

Choose the option for email to sign up.

Enter your student's information. CK12 will ask students to input their teacher email. PLEASE ENTER THE TEACHER'S EMAIL: and the teacher will complete the registration process.

When registration is complete, the teacher will email you the username and password for your student account.

üí° üöÄ Mission Strategy: Step-by-Step

*(Use this guide to help you complete the instructions above)*

1. Clarification: If you don't have the 'Family Vacation Worksheet', grab a blank paper.

2. List 4 categories: Travel Cost, Hotel Cost, Food Cost, Ticket Cost.

3. Research real prices online for a park in Orlando.

4. Add them all up for the Grand Total.

5. Divide by 12 to see how much you need to save each month.
